attributes.comment:
I am in opposition to the fee increases associated with applications for Immigration
and Naturalization. As an adoptive parent to be of a child from China, I have
already paid the fees once and will now be required to do so again because the
procedures for adoption in China exceed the 18 month expiration date on the
approvals.

Proposals to increase the valid dates of the USCIS approvals have been already
been declined so there is no way for an adoptive family to avoid paying the costs
twice (with no additional benefits or services).

By increasing the fees, a heavier financial burden is being placed on adoptive
families who have already followed US laws and procedures once; we are being
financially penalized for adoption processes that are beyond our control.

The US has already recognized the importance of both international and domestic
adoption by providing a tax credit of almost $11,000. While I know the money
goes different places and impacts federal financing in different ways, this is an
example of government agencies working in ways that are in opposition to each
other and creating more unnecessary bureaucracy.

I understand that costs are rising and respectfully request that if fees must be
raised, persons required to refile for adoption due to the adoption process taking
longer than 18 months (and therefore by no fault of their loan) be required to pay a
reduced fee for the second application.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Catherine Buyarski
